Authors: YaPing Ping Lian, Ablat Tohtirjap, fang - wu
Title:
Two new species of Dacrymyces (Dacrymycetales, Basidiomycota)
from southwestern China
Abstract:
Dacrymyces is typically characterized by sessile,
pustulate to pulvinate, yellowish, gelatinous basidiomata, hyphae
without clamp connections, bifurcate basidia and septate basidiospores.
Five specimens with these typical characteristics of Dacrymyces were
collected from southwestern China. Phylogenetic analyses of Dacrymyces
were performed by the combined ITS+nLSU dataset, and five specimens were
gathered into two distinct lineages in the phylogeny. These specimens
are identified as two new species, D. cerebellum and D. sinostenosporus
based on morphological characteristics and phylogenetic analysis.
Detailed characteristics with morphological photos of two new species
are provided here.
